subject: RE: [junit] TestSuite problem
msgSnippet: Hey Bo, If you include a method like: public void testPlaceHolder() { } Then the error about not having any test will disappear. The error message you are
messageBody:
Hey Bo,

If you include a method like:

public void testPlaceHolder() {
}

Then the error about not having any test will disappear. The error message
you are getting is a result of JUnit expecting test methods in these classes

Sandy

-----Original Message-----
From: Bo Rasmussen [mailto:krogenlund@...]
Sent: Tuesday, October 14, 2003 6:00 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] TestSuite problem


Hi,

We have organized our tests such that there is a TestSuite for each
package aggregating TestCases. This TestSuite is called
dk.company.module.TestPackage. In addition to that we have a project
level TestSuite which aggregates package level test suites. The
problem is that when the package level suites are run the testcases
are run alright. When the project level testsuite is employed JUnit
fails to recognize testcases...

Generally the problem is how to nest TestSuites.....

The source for package level TestSuite is
public class TestPackage
extends TestSuite {

public TestPackage(String s) {
super(s);
}

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
// Just one test case right now
suite.addTest(new TestSuite
dk.company.module.TestBlackBoard.class));
return suite;
}
}

The source for project level TestSuite is

public class TestProject
extends TestSuite {

public TestProject(String s) {
super(s);
}

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
suite.addTestSuite(dk.sagem.emc.TestPackage.class);
return suite;
}
}

Regards
-Bo
